author: Andrew Lieb
text: 'Solid place for Sunday Brunch and we were seated in a private room in the back. The pancakes and burger were excellent. Will definitely be back soon!'

author: Audrey
text: 'Great food
column6: and ambiance. Always have a good time here. They have a nice menu and also live music for dinner whenever I‚Äôve gone in the weekends. Cozy date night place to go out without the pretentiousness.'

author: rachel kay
text: 'No vegan options - disappointing'

author: J. B.
text: 'One of the best restaurants in Hoboken. They have live music during dinner. The wine pours are generous.\n\nThe focaccia could have used a bit more seasoning. Other than that
column5: the rest of the food was delicious!'

author: Humphrey Gardner
text: "Nice looking place with charming Maitre'd. Experience marred by one very grumpy waiter and bland mediocre food."

author: zi nyc
text: 'Came here with my husband for a romantic dinner
column5: given the great rating on Google Reviews
column6: but unfortunately it‚Äôs overrated. The food is fairly unremarkable‚Äîthe quality of the food was under average which is a real disappointment given the prices. The only good thing about this restaurant is the cute ambiance.'

author: Rene Rosa
text: "The staff was very nice and the food tasted great. For what came out to about 30 per person
column5: (no alcohol purchased) it was incredibly small portions. The Eggs Bella Vista tells you it comes with Argentinian sausages but what you actually get is one sausage split in half. The home style potatoes were great but you could fit the serving in the palm of a child's hand. It's a shame
column6: because the staff were so nice and dutiful and the food tastes great. 1 English muffin for $4
column7: that was soft and limp
column8: was supposedly toasted. The average brunch or breakfast spot gives you toast with your meal
column9: here you have to buy it and it's not even done well. We left hungry and went to Rumba's in Jersey City for a 2nd meal that wound up costing about $5 a person. Never again."

author: Lorenzo Tattoli
text: 'Good for brunch. Skip for dinner.'

author: Brenda Bradsher
text: 'My husband and I had a lovely dinner here last night. The owner
column6: is very engaging. There was music in the other room but we preferred to stay out by the bar area. I had the rib eye special and it was delicious. My husband had the Seafood Pasta and he really enjoyed it. This was a great find and we‚Äôll be back next time we are in Hoboken'

author: Grant Saunders
text: 'Here for brunch on Sunday good food and attentive service'

text: 'Amanda‚Äôs is one of the best spots around. My girlfriend and I go here for brunch and date nights

text: 'Great place

author: cristina marin
text: 'Fancy place for a romantic date with a high quality service and excellent food!!\nüíØ recommended'

author: Ewan Fisher
text: "This venue really disappoints. On first impressions it looks great. Classy establishment
column5: live music and friendly staff. The menu is quite limited but the vibe gives it the feel of
column6: offer little and do it really well. How restaurants should be rather than offering a huge selection that they will never be able to do right. However the food was a massive let down
column7: especially compared to the venue itself.  The only way I can describe it is cheap bar food disguised in a charming venue. The chicken
column8: served with boxed pasta
column9: had a soapy taste to so much so that it wasn't something I could finish. The short rib however was well cooked but presented like it should be in an average bar.\n\nThe location and vibe must be holding this place higher in rating than it deserves. Either that or the chef was off that night and it didn't meet its usual standard. Left very disappointed

text: "We had a great dinner experience at Amanda's
column5: the place has an old french bistro style and is very pretty and not pretentious. All our dishes were delicious
column6: but the short rib was amazing
column7: together with perfect mashed potatoes and the gravy it felt like a loving comforting hug.\nThey also had live music that we very much appreciated. The walls are full of beautiful art peaces.\nThe only downside is that it was a bit pricey
column8: but we knew that going in. I totally think it was worth it!"

text: 'I have been to Amanda‚Äôs at least twice within past year or two and the food was always really good. My fianc√© and I went for dinner last week and it was a totally different menu. Got a few things the waitress recommended and they were sub par. There must be a new chef there because the food experience was just not the same. Nothing we ordered was at the level of past dishes.'

author: Gene Rabinovich
text: 'We had a nice and relaxing family brunch there on a Saturday morning. The place was not crowded
column5: with patrons peppering the space here and there. Overall
column6: good experience
column7: as we went there open-minded and ready to try new places (new to us anyway) in Hoboken. The restaurant had an easy-going and breezy atmosphere with tables spaced out wide apart and the French doors overlooking the backyard wide open. If you are looking for some quality and familiar American cuisine
column8: Amanda‚Äôs will fit the bill.'

author: Philip Tarashuk

author: Lisa R
text: 'I came here on an anniversary date with my boyfriend we had such an amazing time. This place was beautiful and the ambiance was great. We were greeted by awesome staff from the entrance and walked to our table. Our waitress was so sweet you could tell she was doing a lot and running around but always checked on us and asked us if we were celebrating anything the food was honestly so amazing. They have a full bar my boyfriend got a cocktail and I got a local beer on draft. The beer was awesome and I love that they support local breweries. They had live music and everyone as very covid safe. The band was wearing masks and so was all the staff. The tables were distant and I felt very safe being there. The food was amazing and when they brought us out the dessert it was sweet that it said happy anniversary I would definitely recommend for a get dressed up girls night out or a date night. Thanks for the amazing experience guys I will definitely be coming again.'

text: 'I went here for dinner recently and despite being sat outdoors we could hear the live music from inside. It was very romantic! We tried the potato croquettes
column6: and the seafood tagliatelle. All of them were fantastic! Our server was also very nice and helpful. I will be back!'

text: 'My husband and I go to Amanda‚Äôs all the time and every time has been a great experience. Food is delicious and the staff are always attentive and great.'

text: "Good location for tasty american food. Fell in love with this place from the 1st taste. Next time I'll be back with my coworkers."

author: James Greener
text: 'My wife and I had dinner at Amanda‚Äôs last night with four of our closest friends.  Of course we‚Äôve  had dinner there before
column6: last night was our best experience. The place looked great
column7: the staff was fun and attentive
column8: and the food was awesome. I had the short rib entree last night - delicious!!! The pork chop and the salmon also got good reviews.  There were two talented musicians there as well. The Owners
column10: stopped by our table several times to make sure we were happy.  We were extremely happy!  Well done Amanda‚Äôs!!'

author: Phil Salinardi
text: "Had dinner at  Amanda's last night. 6 good friends. We haven't been out in months. What an enjoyable evening! Starting from a warm greeting from Juan and Julie. Plenty of space - we all felt totally safe. We started off with drinks
column5: and the the incredible empanadas ! Our waiter couldn't be more accommodating. Most of us had the short rib- out of this world. The warm vibe from the live music really put us all in a good place.\nHighly recommend this restaurant."

author: Ruben Mendoza
text: 'If the exquisite food at Amanda‚Äôs won‚Äôt make you keep going back to this restaurant
column6: the amazingly well priced wine list
column7: and the wonderful environment definitely will! The experience during our first visit last month was great
column8: so we decided to return and it was everything we were hoping for and more! It left you with that very rare feeling that you got way more than what you paid for. If all this wasn‚Äôt enough
column9: add the presence of the very talented pianist playing a the perfect repertoire to make your dining experience even greater. Five starts don‚Äôt seem enough to rate Amanda‚Äôs
column10: I would easily give them ten. We strongly recommend this restaurant!'

author: THGI
text: 'Best restaurant in Hoboken and possibly all of Hudson County. Cozy and warm ambience and pretty comfortable outdoor eating space. Excellent food and great variety of wine.  Highly recommended to anyone seeking a quiet and warm dining experience.'

text: 'Amanda‚Äôs has a very nice outdoor dining setup with a live jazz band! The atmosphere was very nice and the service was great. The food was good- we got multiple appetizers and entrees to share between two people and everything was very tasty.'

text: "We have been going to Amanda's for dinner for years now. This is an elegant restaurant that would be great for a romantic dinner as well as a group. We always gravitate toward their early dinner

column7: as usual. Additionally
column8: they now have a vegetarian early menu that also offered really wonderful selections. Nice. We have also enjoyed Sunday brunch here. Amanda's is a long-established

text: "I have been a customer of Amanda's for more than 10 years...love their service and quaity of all their entres."

author: S Chadwick
text: 'Great service and enjoyed the prix fixe menu'

author: Karoline M.
text: 'I‚Äôm sorry but Amanda‚Äôs is so overrated. Yes
column5: the location is beautiful and historic but the main reason to go to a restaurant is the food
column6: and it it always a hit or miss situation: either really bad
column7: or mediocre/ok at best. We‚Äôve come here three times due to invitations
column8: and have been disappointed twice.\n\nWhen coming in with a party of five
column9: the food was not hot upon serving
column10: and one dish came late. And it wasn‚Äôt even busy
column11: it was after 2pm when the main brunch crowd already disappeared.\n\nThe lemon pancakes
column13: did not only arrive late but were mostly burnt (the 2 black-dark brown BURNED PANCAKES were covered up with a medium-brown one)
column14: and the whipped butter on top had been erroneously replaced with savory herb butter
column15: creating an involuntarily unbalanced sweet and savory combination.\n\nThe SALMON EGGS BENEDICT tasted fishy - yes
column16: I get that it‚Äôs fish but it was fishy in a bad way. I regularly savor salmon in all forms (raw
column21: cold smoked) but this one was really off and briny tasting. The spinach tasted bitter and had soaked up liquid
column22: creating an unpleasantly mushy texture. The eggs were on point but were sadly unseasoned
column23: the potatoes were mushy and flavorless
column24: and the side lettuce was literally undressed.\n\nThe LOBSTER PANZANELLA was ok - however panzanella is supposed to be a bread salad
column25: and this one was just topped with a few croutons
column26: which tasted prepackaged. So technically not panzanella (just call it lobster salad).\n\nFinally
column28: the latte and cappuccino were basically filter coffee with half and half
column29: served in the same mug as the filter coffee
column31: with foamy milk and a dash of cocoa
column32: how it‚Äôs supposed to be. I get I‚Äôm not at a roastery but it‚Äôs a brunch place so I expect the coffee to be good. Why even offer anything but filter coffee if you can‚Äôt deliver.'

author: Nathan Turoff
text: 'Comfortable and friendly. Good food.'

author: dante afk
text: "Over the years we have come here about 5 times for special occasions
column5: it's supposed to be a fancy brunch place - well it's the only one in Hoboken.\n\nThis was the last time we visited this place. pretentious. Food is disappointing
column6: always luke warm. If you get side fries with your dish
column7: they taste like they were from yesterday. You order pancakes
column8: they put in herb butter.\n\nIf you go to a place like this
column10: food that you cannot make at home. Well let me tell you
column11: if I cook whatever I order at this place
column13: and it's being served hot.\n\nStaff friendly-ness is hit and miss. Our waiter yesterday had an annoyed vibe on her."

author: Virginia Henderson
text: "This is a GREAT greasy-spoon diner. There are not many of these gems left in major metros and it's my late-night SFO jam. No nonsense service
column5: food delivered quickly and killer omelettes. I wish I had one in MSP rather than the breakfast chains that are getting way to classy and expensive. Don't sell out Pinecrest!"

text: "I love the early dinner menu. The service was excellent. The food was to die for. This was easily one of the best meals I've ever had. The duck confit was the star of the show. text: "Beautiful ambience. The food is good but the service is best. Street parking at Hoboken can be found few blocks down. I would recommend reservation to avoid wait. text: 'Went here for my brothers birthday in December 2016. Food is tasty. Only qualms i had were the portion sizes were small and somewhat expensive

text: "Fantastic food but seemed like an off-night for the service as it took too long pretty much every step of the way. But
column5: easy to overlook as the food makes this place really worth it. Had the grilled octopus to start and at the recommendation of our server ordered the beef short rib. Both were the best of these I've ever had. Highly recommend."

author: Sean Johnson
text: 'Really good food and great service In a cute setting.'

author: Alonzo Cudd
text:
"A HOBOKEN GEM

We were here visiting family and found this well rated restaurant on Google maps (where else?). We were eating with an infant and came in right when they opened at 5pm. I know this isn't a normal dining time for most people but the advantage was that they had an early dinner menu which was such a good deal that two people from our party ordered off of it.
I had their Summer Vegetable Risotto which had butternut squash that was the perfect firmness and fresh peas that were bursting with flavor all complimented with some of the best risotto I've ever had. The menu overall is very well rounded and they have a great cocktail
column6: and local beer menu.\nThe staff was very professional and attentive. We got two visits from their very friendly and accommodating dining room manager. Overall the service was perfect especially considering we came a 2 year old which often times can leave us feeling treated like lepers."

author: Eileen R.
text: "Small
column5: noisy but lovely. A continental menu. The normal prices are expensive
column6: but if you can get there for their early bird
column7: it's certainly worth the price ($19). You get three courses
column8: and a bottle of house wine is $25. The waitstaff is terrific. You'll find your drinking glasses filled without even asking. Try the key lime pie for dessert. It comes with berries and a dollop of real whipped cream. Yummy. Parking is a real problem
column9: but they have an arrangement with a nearby garage."

author: Mah Rezaa
text: 'If you like older styles you would like the architecture of the main room probably. Its like a house restored as a restaurant. Different rooms for different guests. Portion are a bit smaller than other brunches in the area.'

author: Morris DeCandia
text: 'Charming decor with a romantic vibe. Attentive staff and management. Menu selection is super.  Year after year a place we enjoy visiting.'

author: Ed Jung
text: 'the early dinner fixed price dinners are a great value.  get a few appetizers for the table as the main course might be a little small for someone with a large appetite. must be seated before 5:30 in order to order it.'

author: Michael Taylor
text: "Went here for the first time and ate brunch.  The place is warm and inviting
column5: the staff was friendly  and extremely accommodating.   We had a party of 7 and we did a lot if talking and laughing together
column6: and at no time did anyone feel like we were being rushed though the meal.  The food was prepared as ordered
column7: with several of us having different eggs Benedict choices
column8: a few omelets
column9: and several other selections from the brunch menu.  One of my eggs was slightly overcooked
column10: which is the only reason I didnt rate the place a 5.   The sides were generous portions as were the main courses.  All in all
column11: I will return for sure to try out the rest of the menu.  We came on a Sunday
column12: late morning  and there was plenty of street parking.  Not sure if the parking would be as easy in the evening
column13: but there are lots nearby.  Try this place and you won't be disappointed."

column8: parties

author: Dot Stein
text: "Best restaurant in Hoboken
column5: hands down. The service is impeccable. Food is tasty and they have a massive wine selection. I go here when I want to be spoiled. The service in most all Hoboken eateries is horrific (snotty
column6: lazy
column7: arrogant students) but at Amanda's
column8: they are clearly well trained. There are however
column9: three things I wish Amanda's had (1) Wifi (my kid wants to watch videos while waiting for his food) (2) Whole wheat bread/rolls (yes
column10: their white rolls are tasty but Hoboken is packed with health concious people; please update and offer healthy rolls) (3) More veggie options (seriously lacking vegetarian options as well as veggie sides). But as you can see

text: "Excellent food

author: Vivian Lu
text: "What a cozy little place!  The early bird special is definitely worth a trip and the portions are generous for the price.  The food is great and the atmosphere is almost private and certainly a bit romantic.  The place reminds me of a study in an old estate.  One thing I do note is that our waiter cracked the cork while opening our wine and either did not notice or did not care as he attempted to serve us a glass full of cork to taste...  When I pointed this out
column5: he grabbed a different glass from another table and poured us some more wine with cork chunks into it...  That's really not a very acceptable response.  He finally admitted that he might need to get a new bottle after I pointed out that I saw him crack the cork and that the entire bottle was filled with cork pieces.  Other than this hiccup
column6: dinner was great!"

author: ÊùéÈÄöËææ
text: 'The best restaurant in the Hoboken. Graceful environment and nice service.  The price of 3-courses menu is acceptable.'

author: Melanie Tam
text: "I never knew I liked truffle so much until Amanda's. For me
column5: truffle was just another mushroom: basic AF. But their Truffle Fusilli pasta has opened my eyes to a whole new world. I felt like I was riding on a magic carpet when I ate it. But I'll get to that a bit later.\n\nMy BF
column6: his parents
column7: and I arrived at around 8 on a Friday but we were seated almost immediately. The place is small. I'm not sure if they accept ressos but if they do
column8: it would be a good idea to make them.\n\nA lot of the appetizers appealed to us
column9: but not so much the entrees. So we decided to just order a bunch of appetizers
column11: and share everything. This is what we ordered:\n\nGrilled Octopus with chorizo
column14: sorrel ($16) - both the octopus and the chorizo were very chewy. I wouldn't recommend this.\n\nCreamy Polenta with sausage ragu
column15: shaved parmesan ($10) - the flavor was okay but the texture was definitely not what I was expecting. I don't know if I would call this 'creamy polenta'. A block of polenta would be more accurate.\n\nChef's Charcuterie Board (cured meats
column19: spread - $16) - the spread is some kind of bacon jam (?) Not exactly sure what it was but it was amazing. That paired with either of the cheeses it came with
column20: was perfect. The cured meats were just okay. Maybe cured meats is just not their forte.\n\nLamb Meatballs (special of the day) - I didn't taste any of the gaminess of the lamb
column21: which either meant it was really good
column22: or it was just a bunch of leftover ground mystery meat. Either way
column24: but certainly not least - the star of the show: Truffle Fusilli Pasta with roasted woodland mushrooms
column27: mushroom reduction ($24). This was everyone's favorite. They don't skimp on the pasta
column29: they don't skimp on the truffle. I would most definitely come back just for this pasta. It's a tad pricy but truffle tends to be
column32: but the pasta is what made me give Amanda's the 4 stars. Next time
column33: I'll skip the apps and go straight for that pasta. Their brunch menu also sounds pretty good
column34: and their prix fixe early dinner menu seems like a great deal. Can't wait to come back!\n\nTip - drinks are reasonably priced - the cheapest bottle of wine you can get is $30."

author: Matthew Cunningham
text: "The brunch at Amanda's is absolutely amazing! I got the Egg Benedict
column5: which was great. You must come here."

author: Mark Bragen
text: "Amanda's offers fantastic food and menu with a great wine selection. Their early menu is a great option for an early dinner. The service was impeccable and the decor a great touch for a Hoboken establishment. The parking is a bit tough on the weekends but well worth it!"

author: Elizabeth Markham
text: "I have heard such rave reviews for this place; honestly
column5: I was pretty underwhelmed considering the price for brunch. I ordered the crispy eggs
column6: and they were good - definitely unique - but they didn't blow me away. My partner got an omelette and he was also happy
column7: but not extremely impressed. In addition
column8: service was mixed; they were very attentive through the beginning of our meal
column9: but I had to flag someone down twice for a coffee refill. Maybe they were just having an off day... It's a great space
column10: and I really wanted to like it. I could imagine coming back for dinner.\n\nPS - The Sunday morning we were there
column11: there were at least 4 large parties (two bridal showers
column13: and one event that was perhaps for business) - this place seems really equipped to deal with large parties."

author: nancy alexander
text: "I attended a baby shower at Amanda's yesterday.  The setting
column6: and the wait staff was absolutely one of the best I've ever encountered.  They were friendly and professional
column7: and dealt with our large group as though we were a party of two!  Amanda's is the whole package!"

author: Ashley Graham
text: 'Friendly staff
column5: quality food. Most of the d√©cor is quaint. That one portrait though...\n\nI will be returning.'

author: Chris Lee
text: 'This place quickly caught my heart the minute I stepped inside. Inside decor was simply so adorable
column5: with portraits and shades on the wall. I am not really an old-fashion type of person
column6: nevertheless I can never say no to the acquaintance feeling it generated.\nWe ordered egg Benedict with salmon
column7: as well as the crispy egg. Especially recommend the crispy egg
column8: with melting yolk hiding in the center and covered by the crispy crust. Benedict was not special
column9: but it was accompanied by fruits and fries
column10: so a full combo. The room was quickly filled when we finished our brunch.Attentive service so will definitely come back.'

text: 'Food is delicious

text: 'Lovely Italian restaurant
column5: years of providing a quality dining experience in all aspects.'

author: Ana Ruvalcaba
text: 'Early dinner at 5:30pm is an awesome deal! Three course pre-fixe menu for two for $32 and everything was fresh
column6: and the service was impeccable. Two potential drawbacks are that it was pretty crowded (and therefore somewhat noisy) and the walking distance from the Path/Light Rail train is not far but would stink in bad weather. Regardless I enjoyed this place and will definitely be back.'

author: Candra Savage
text: "I had some of the worst service at this restaurant!  I love the food
column6: and atmosphere of Amanda's but sadly have had really poor service.  It makes the money you spend there not worth it.  Attitude from the staff and no attention from the manager.  I will sadly not be going back."

author: Brad Moats
text: 'Awesome food and service.  Spicy Seafood Stew.  Yes!!'

author: Steven Schmidt
text: "Amanda's was a devine restaurant. The food was delicious
column6: and the atmosphere was beautiful. It may be a bit pricey
column7: but if you can afford it
column8: it's worth the money."

author: Daniel Lieuwen
text:
'The 5 and 530 seatings are probably the best deal in Hoboken.  A 3-course meal for $16/person.  The food is scrumptious.

The service is good.  I was avoiding dairy and none of the desserts worked---so the waiter checked and got me sorbet instead.

If you come later
column5: the price of main courses goes up to the high $20s.  Tried that once.  The portion was enormous---so leftovers for next day.\n\nThey used to play Big Band and Jazz
column6: so much classier music choices than is normal in Hoboken.  The most recent visit though saw more recent music (Beatles through the 80s)
column7: which I liked less well.'

author: Sam Caino
text: "Fanciest restaurant in Hoboken.  A great place for a special occasion.  The New Year's Eve package was great.  It was a lot of fun dancing in between courses and ringing in the New Year.  Good band who took requests."

author: KEE NJ
text: 'A LOVELY BROWNSTONE SETTING
column6: AND A FEELING OF HAVING GONE BACK IN TIME.'

author: Matt Galo
text: 'It was one of the more expensive places in Hoboken
column5: but the food was good enough.'

author: Todd Abrams
text: 'Had an OK dinner there.  Prices were too high for me.'

author: RichS230
text: 'I was here on Valentine\'s day. Unfortunately
column5: there was a fixed menu. The food was delicious
column6: albeit the portions were rather small.  The menu was limited and grossly overpriced.  The service and staff were outstanding
column7: as was the decor.  If only the quality of the meal was better and at a much more reasonable price point.  However
column8: I am looking forward to going again to sample the "regular" menu.'

author: Jason Kaplan
text: 'Had no idea Hoboken had this type of romantic getaway. Old school service (the waiters wear bow ties) - a small but delicious menu and a great decor made this a home run date for me and my wife.\n\nWill definitely be making return trips.  If you want to feel like an adult in Hoboken
column5: this is the place to go'

author: Vivian Carrieri
text: 'If you want quality food
column6: this is the place. I have never had anything below an exceptional meal here.'

author: Sandi Wodakow
text: 'a very quaint spot to brunch or celebrate a special occasion if the group is not too large. fairly standard food but nice little rooms to hold your unique event.'

author: Natalie Flores
text: 'My favorite place in Hoboken
column5: I have been here for NYE numerous times and for brunch. The food is always good and the decor is awesome. I also had my bridal brunch here and they treated us very good. The service is excellent and I think that this is the best restaurant in Hoboken.'

author: John Farina
text: "The early bird dinner for two is wonderful food and such a bargain.  I would eat there 3 nites a week if it wasn't such a trek from No. Bergen County.   Parking is a pain but it's the price you pay for this gem.  Located just across the Hudson from the best the Big Apple has to offer and able to stand up to any of them."

author: Timothy Ericson
text: 'Amanda\'s is one of my favorite restaurants! I moved from the Hoboken area 8 years ago and still come back just to eat here. I was finally able to get back to the area this Sunday and of course grabbed dinner at Amanda\'s. When I made the reservation on opentable I noted that my friend was leaving for Australia the following day. When we ordered dessert
column5: they surprised her by writing "Bon Voyage" on the plate in chocolate! Its the attention to small details that makes Amanda\'s a 5-star restaurant.'

author: Des O'Grady
text: 'Bring your parents. Fancy dining.'

author: Ken Boyar
text: "HOBOKEN'S FINEST DINING WHERE THERE ARE NO MISSES FROM THE KITCHEN AND PLEASANT SERVICE TO MAKE YOU FEEL LIKE YOU'RE DINING IN SOMEONE'S HOME."

author: Carlo Lipizzi
text: 'you pay more than you get here'

author: Elizabeth P
text: "I just had my baby shower at Amanda's and have to thank them for such a wonderful time.  The private room was intimate and charming
column5: the service was wonderful (present but not annoying or ever rushing or imposing) and the food and drinks were fabulous.  I would have another function here in a heartbeat."

author: Scott McAllister
text: 'food was absolutely fantastic - every part of the meal delivered in a big way.  mussels
column6: halibut
column7: chorizo stuffed pork chop
column8: and caramel apple tart.  pair this with a very reasonably priced wine list
column9: and you have a top notch experience.'

author: Roger Pelegrinelli
text: 'I\'ve been a regular customer for the past 3 years and I never had a bad experience at this beautiful place. The food
column6: atmosphere... everything is so well put together. I always bring my friends from London and they all love it! If you are tired of pretentious restaurants with loud music
column7: arrogant staff
column8: over the top food with not flavor
column9: then make your way to Amanda\'s. They also offer a famous "early bird menu" that is great value for money. I never get tired of Amanda\'s and hope that you will fall in love with it too!!'

author: Josh Linder
text: 'still the best in hoboken - has really capitalized on the zagat'
